question:
A global company is using Amazon API Gateway to design REST APIs for its loyalty club users in the us-east-1 Region and the ap-southeast-2 Region. A solutions architect must design a solution to protect these API Gateway managed REST APIs across multiple accounts from SQL injection and cross-site scripting attacks.
Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST amount of administrative effort?

options.A: Set up AWS WAF in both Regions. Associate Regional web ACLs with an API stage.
options.B: Set up AWS Firewall Manager in both Regions. Centrally configure AWS WAF rules.
options.C: Set up AWS Shield in both Regions. Associate Regional web ACLs with an API stage.
options.D: Set up AWS Shield in one of the Regions. Associate Regional web ACLs with an API stage.

explanation: AWS Firewall Manager enables centralized management of WAF rules across multiple accounts and regions with least administrative effort. Individual WAF setup in each region requires more administration.
